alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 8:21PM PDT until August 18 at 11:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 1130 PM PDT. * At 821 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving into the Morongo Basin from the south. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Twentynine Palms, Yucca Valley, Twentynine Palms Base, Twentynine Palms Airport, Joshua Tree Lake Campground, Joshua Tree and Morongo Valley. This includes the following roads... State Route 247 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 1 and 5. State Route 62 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 1 and 57. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
